trans-unit.source: Before you can store data in your new mobile service, you must create a new storage table in the service.
trans-unit.target: Before you can store data in your new mobile service, you must create a new storage table in the service.

trans-unit.source: These steps show how to use Visual Studio 2013 to create a new table in the mobile service.
trans-unit.target: These steps show how to use Visual Studio 2013 to create a new table in the mobile service.

trans-unit.source: Then you update the app to use Mobile Services to store items in Azure instead of in the local collection.
trans-unit.target: Then you update the app to use Mobile Services to store items in Azure instead of in the local collection.

trans-unit.source: In Server Explorer, expand Azure Mobile Services, right-click your mobile service, click Create Table, then type TodoItem in Table Name.
trans-unit.target: In Server Explorer, expand Azure Mobile Services, right-click your mobile service, click Create Table, then type TodoItem in Table Name.

trans-unit.source: Expand Advanced, verify that the table operation permissions default to Anybody with the Application Key, then click Create.
trans-unit.target: Expand Advanced, verify that the table operation permissions default to Anybody with the Application Key, then click Create.

trans-unit.source: This creates the TodoItem table on the server, where anyone that has the application key can access and change data in the table without having to first be authenticated.
trans-unit.target: This creates the TodoItem table on the server, where anyone that has the application key can access and change data in the table without having to first be authenticated.

trans-unit.source: The application key is distributed with the application.
trans-unit.target: The application key is distributed with the application.

trans-unit.source: Because this key is not securely distributed, it cannot be considered a security token.
trans-unit.target: Because this key is not securely distributed, it cannot be considered a security token.

trans-unit.source: To secure access to your mobile service data, you must instead authenticate users before accessing.
trans-unit.target: To secure access to your mobile service data, you must instead authenticate users before accessing.

trans-unit.source: New tables are created with the Id, _createdAt, _updatedAt, and __version columns.
trans-unit.target: New tables are created with the Id, _createdAt, _updatedAt, and __version columns.

trans-unit.source: When dynamic schema is enabled, Mobile Services automatically generates new columns based on the JSON object in the insert or update request.
trans-unit.target: When dynamic schema is enabled, Mobile Services automatically generates new columns based on the JSON object in the insert or update request.
